intro: Elymus alaskanus subsp. subalpinus, commonly known as the Alaska subalpine grass, is a perennial grass species native to the mountainous regions of Alaska and western Canada. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically growing in alpine tundra and subalpine meadows.
